structured.description: An HMAC class for generating hashed messages using a provided key and a specified digest algorithm. The class provides properties and methods for generating and manipulating HMACs, including a `digest` method that uses the provided digest algorithm to generate a hash of the message. Additionally, the code includes a `new` function for creating a new HMAC instance with a given key and digest algorithm, and a `digest` function for generating a hashed message using a given key and digest algorithm. The code also defines various constants and functions used in the implementation of the HMAC class.

items.description: Generates an HMAC (Hash-based Message Authentication Code) based on a given key and message. It takes care of generating the inner and outer hashes, handling the block size, and returning the final digest.

attributes.name: blocksize
attributes.description: 64 by default, which represents the size of the block to be used when hashing the message. It can be changed through the constructor or property setters.

attributes.name: digest_cons
attributes.description: The lambda function that generates the digest of the input message when called.

attributes.name: outer
attributes.description: Used to store the result of updating a message using the underlying digest algorithm, such as SHA-256 or SHA-512.

attributes.name: inner
attributes.description: Used for hashing password. It is initialized with a digest object, which is used to hash the password.

attributes.name: digest_size
attributes.description: 36 bits by default, indicating the size of the digest block used for hashing.

attributes.name: block_size
attributes.description: 64 by default. It represents the size of the block used for the HMAC calculation.

attributes.name: update
attributes.description: Used to update the inner digest with a given message.

items.name: HMAC

items.description: Of the HMAC class initializes instance variables and performs key and digest manipulation before updating the outer and inner states of the object.

params.name: key
params.description: Required to be passed as an argument during construction of the object.

params.name: msg
params.description: Optional, it is used to update the message digest with additional data.

params.name: digestmod
params.description: Required to be set to a hash function name, such as `md5`, `sha256`, or `ripemd160`.

items.name: __init__

items.description: In the `HMAC` class generates a unique string identifier for the inner object's name, appending it to "-hmac-".

returns.description: A concatenation of the string "hmac-" and the value of its inner attribute `name`.

items.name: name

items.description: Updates the inner state of an instance of the `HMAC` class with the given message `msg`.

params.name: msg
params.description: Updated with an object or instance value by calling the update method on it.

items.name: update

items.description: Creates a new instance of the `HMAC` class with the same attributes as the original, except for the digest values which are copied and the inner and outer objects which are also copied.

returns.description: An instance of the same class as the original object, containing copied values of `digest_cons`, `digest_size`, `inner`, and `outer`.

items.name: copy

items.description: Updates the outer object's state by copying the inner digest and merging it with the existing outer state, returning the updated outer state.
items.name: _current

items.description: Computes the digest of the current state of an HMAC object using the underlying hash function.

returns.description: A subclass of bytes representing the result of hashing the current state of the HMAC algorithm.

items.name: digest

items.description: In the `HMAC` class generates the hexadecimal digest of the current state of the object's internal buffer using the `hexdigest` method of the `hashlib` module.

returns.description: A hexadecimal representation of the current value of an object.

items.name: hexdigest

items.description: Takes a key, message, and digest as input and performs an authentication or message integrity check using either OpenSSL's HMAC method or Hashlib's SHA-256 hash function, depending on the type of digest provided.

params.name: msg
params.description: Passed as input to the function for hashing.

params.name: digest
params.description: Used to specify the hash algorithm for the message digest calculation.

returns.description: The result of applying a message authentication code (MAC) to the given `key`, `msg`, and `digest` parameters using OpenSSL or hashlib library.

items.name: digest
